programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.desc: Lucas and Mark find themselves exposed to anthrax after they adopt a stray horse whose owner has been killed in a gunfight.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: A portrait painter plans crimes while sketching his models, who are chosen to help the artist gain financial reward.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene, Pat, and a parson rid the town of Scorpion of a gambling ring and crooked politicians.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: To save the new school, Gene bets the ranch on a chariot race.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene is on the trail of an arms-smuggling gang, following them to the Mexican border where he joins with a law-enforcement officer to stop the gang's crooked operations.

programme.title: Apache
programme.desc: The lone Apache, Massai, valiantly fights a one-man war against the U.S. Army in his attempt to remain free at any cost.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene aids two women who are victims of a mail-order marriage racket.

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Two gunmen track an escaped murderer to a lawless Western town, where they cross paths with a beautiful widow with a dangerous agenda.

programme.title: Valdez Is Coming
programme.desc: A Mexican-American lawman seeks revenge against a rancher who tricked him into shooting an innocent man and then left him in the desert to die alone.

programme.title: The Scalphunters
programme.desc: A lively and ribald western about a frontier-wise fur trapper who loses his pelts to a band of Kiowas in exchange for a slave he doesn't want.

programme.title: Vera Cruz
programme.desc: Two soldiers of fortune escort gold from Mexico City to Vera Cruz through a barrage of bullets and double-crosses during the 1866 Mexican Rebellion.

programme.title: Wild Rovers
programme.desc: Tired of his job at a ranch owned by Walter Buckman (Karl Malden), Frank Post (Ryan O'Neal) wants to pull a heist, and when his much older coworker, Ross Bodine (William Holden), sees nothing better on the horizon, the cowboys agree to team up for the crime. After filling their pockets with loot from a local bank, Frank and Ross ride toward what they hope is freedom. But the younger Buckmans, Paul (Joe Don Baker) and John (Tom Skerritt), pursue them over the rough land of the Southwest.

programme.title: Lawman
programme.desc: Lee J. Cobb, Robert Duvall, Robert Ryan and Burt Lancaster star in this film that reveals a deadly and truthful look at the way the West really was.

programme.title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
programme.desc: Lawman Wyatt Earp (Burt Lancaster) and gunfighter John "Doc" Holliday (Kirk Douglas) find themselves together again in Tombstone, Ariz., despite the tumultuous history between them. Earp comes to Arizona on a mission to bring the Clayton clan to justice. Meanwhile, Holliday becomes incensed with the decision of Kate Fisher (Jo Van Fleet) to turn him down in favor of another gunfighter (John Ireland), ultimately leading Holliday to join Earp's side in a confrontation with the Claytons.

programme.title: Vengeance Valley
programme.desc: Two sons, one biological and the other adopted, of a Colorado cattle baron grow up and fight for control of their father's business empire.

programme.title: The Hanged Man
programme.desc: Miraculously still alive after his hanging, a gunfighter in need of redemption defends a beautiful young widow's farm from a vicious land grabber.

programme.title: The Last Outlaw
programme.desc: A former bandit finds the frontier a very different place when he emerges from prison after serving 25 years.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho receive aid from a traveling dentist when they try to track down a notorious killer who's now posing as a cattle dealer.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco is on the case when a station master and a gold shipment go missing.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in the West
programme.desc: There's a single piece of land around Flagstone with water on it, and rail baron Morton (Gabriele Ferzetti) aims to have it, knowing the new railroad will have to stop there. He sends his henchman Frank (Henry Fonda) to scare the land's owner, McBain (Frank Wolff), but Frank kills him instead and pins it on a known bandit, Cheyenne (Jason Robards). Meanwhile, a mysterious gunslinger with a score to settle (Charles Bronson) and McBain's new wife, Jill (Claudia Cardinale), arrive in town.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt Clark sets out on the trail of a gang of cattle rustlers led by one of the West's youngest and most notorious outlaws, Billy Bonney, aka Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt Clark and his assistant pursue the vengeful James brothers, Frank and Jesse, who declare war on the law after their young half-brother is killed in a police ambush.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: The Detective goes after Apache chief Geronimo (Chief Yowlachie), who has been identified by Joe Burns (Emile Meyer), as the leader of a band of freight-car robbers.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie are asked by Colonel Marsham to infiltrate the vicious Quantrill gang. They do so on the eve of the Lawrence Kansas massacre that they are unable to prevent.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Hollister and Harris Claibourne spring into action when the nearby town of Sunglow is besieged by criminals in the wake of its sheriff's murder.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Sheriff Hollister volunteers to escort a young visitor to see her uncle on a nearby ranch, but her relative appears to be missing, and the man's partner is less than helpful.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After the end of the Civil War, General Phil Sheridan, who has been appointed Governor of the New Mexico Territory, is on an inspection tour of the country.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A famous gunfighter marries and decides to retire. He and his wife settle down in North Fork and open a store, but three outlaws arrive in town looking to best him in a gunfight.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An old friend of Lucas McCain's, a traveling photographer, comes to North Fork plying his trade. When a murder is committed, the photographer is accused of the crime.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The townsfolk of North Fork decide to give a young couple a shivaree celebration. When the drunken crowd gets out of hand and roughs up the bride-to-be, the young groom challenges them.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: New Orleans' underworld conspires to rub out administrator Colton right when Colton's sister Agatha finally arrives on a visit. Yancy expected a Boston battle-ax, but he's smitten with her charm and wit. Colton has a heavy workload, fending off crime czar Lance Carter, and wowing Agatha with his Reconstruction wizardry, while building a romantic blockade between her and Yancy.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Mr. Proctor, a friend of the Derringer family, is sent to New Orleans with a message from a former general in the Civil War. But before he is able to relay the message to Yancy, Mr. Proctor is assassinated, leaving Yancy to uncover the mystery behind the Confederate half dollar Mr. Proctor was carrying when he died.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: An all-male group is determined to keep women from voting.

programme.title: Bat Masterson

programme.title: Zane Grey Theater
programme.desc: Lt. Sam Kenyon tries to tame a rebellious town.

programme.desc: Lucas welcomes his old friend Tom Birch, who once saved his life, unaware that the man is now a bank robber on the run with his gang.

programme.desc: A concert by stand-up comic, Gallagher, featuring his usual plays on words and his patented bizarre use of props, climaxing with a new use for watermelons.

programme.title: The Gallagher Collection
programme.desc: Lock up your watermelons, and anything else that splatters! With a name like "Sledge-O-Matic" you know Gallagher is sure to get crazy in this special filmed in 2000!

programme.title: The Gallagher Collection
programme.desc: In 1982 Gallagher had a lot on his mind. Forever the prop comedian, Gallagher points out all the things that annoy him - from the post office, to kitchen habits, to the media, no one is safe from his list!

programme.title: Godfrey: Regular Black
programme.desc: The hilarious, fearless comic discusses college, public transportation, and more in this comedy special performed in his hometown of Chicago.

programme.title: Josh Blue: Delete
programme.desc: With an undeniably unique world view, Blue explores preconceived notions of disability and how the community feels about being called “inspirational.”

programme.title: Josh Blue: Sticky Change
programme.desc: Quipster Josh Blue hits the stage where he turns his cerebral palsy and cross-cultural marriage into comedy gold.

programme.title: Josh Blue: The Disabled List
programme.desc: The winner of Last Comic Standing discusses the obvious questions people ask him, misunderstandings about being a disabled person, and more.

programme.title: Rob Schneider: Soy Sauce and the Holocaust
programme.desc: Rob Schneider takes on lessons about love and other cultures, and telling side-splitting stories of the three hoods: childhood, adulthood, and parenthood.

programme.title: Leanne Morgan: So Yummy
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Vol. 15
programme.desc: KevOnStage hosts a night of stand-up comedy featuring Tony Valentino and Brennon Edwards.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Vol. 16
programme.desc: KevOnStage hosts a night of stand-up comedy featuring Tony Valentino and Brennon Edwards.

programme.title: Keith Stubbs: Poundcake
programme.desc: Triple threat in comedy, acting, and DJing, Keith Stubbs brings his suburban gangster persona “Pound Cake” to the stage before a live audience.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquist’s dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World

programme.desc: Monty and the team are at RHS Rosemoor in Devon to find out about their fruit trees and sedum collection, and Joe visits Scampston Hall, home of a ten-year experiment in naturalistic planting by garden designer Piet Oudolf.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants for pollinators in the Wildlife Garden and trims his box topiary cones. He also takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer veg harvest. Meanwhile, Carol Klein visits stunning Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, bringing viewers up to date on how it has been developing, as well as giving advice on growing hydrangeas. Toby Buckland shares his tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, catching viewers up on his new patio project and discussing his plans for the autumn. Arit Anderson travels to Somerset to meet landscape designer Dan Pearson, to find out about the design and planting principles he has used to create his own garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to stake dahlias, sows seeds of perennials and celebrates an abundant vegetable harvest. The team meet a landscape designer in Cornwall who creates gardens that are not only sustainable but also beautiful and edible.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles some seasonal gardening jobs at Longmeadow and guest presenter Matthew Wilson has some ideas to brighten up a dark, north-facing wall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives tips on moving plants which are in the wrong place or have outgrown their space, shows how to store chilies and harvests the last of his tomatoes. Rachel de Thame returns to Longmeadow to talk to Monty about her return to health and to plant up pots for spring colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the wonder of trees and explore the vital role they play in gardens and the wider landscape. Zoe Ball joins Toby Buckland on a visit to a tree project in North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about the maintenance this week at Longmeadow, as Monty cuts back and divides spring flowering plants. Nick Bailey goes to Ham House in Richmond to see how they are coping with the ravages of box tree caterpillar and Arit Anderson visits a garden in Suffolk to find out about the concept of rewilding.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don and Nigel make the most of the season and prepare for the winter ahead. Meanwhile Carol Klein is in Surrey looking at wild and cultivated heathers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with summer maintenance in his wildlife garden and recommends plants for deep, dry shade under trees, as well as giving advice on what to plant now for late summer harvests.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow this week, Monty reaps a harvest from the vegetable garden, plants up a seasonal pot and gives a masterclass on how to make the perfect compost. Adam Frost travels to York to meet a couple who took on 20 acres of land and filled it with flowers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the plants in the jewel garden reach the peak of their late summer glory, Monty starts planning for the spring when he plants ferns and gives advice on the care and maintenance of wildlife ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets going with some autumn garden maintenance whilst looking back over the year and reviewing his borders - which plants have done well and others that haven't. As he clears annuals that are past their best he plans a colourful display for late spring by planting up the garden with tulips. Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage continuing work on her new raised beds and taming an overgrown and unruly rambling rose.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn on the horizon, the seasonal planting of bulbs for spring-flowering begins at Longmeadow. Frances Tophill meets a gardener whose allotment is filled with both traditional and exotic vegetables and Toby Buckland visits The Newt in Somerset to find out about its chequered garden history and to explore its emergence as one of the UK's most exciting gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team are at RHS Rosemoor in Devon to find out about their fruit trees and sedum collection, and Joe visits Scampston Hall, home of a ten-year experiment in naturalistic planting by garden designer Piet Oudolf.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don harvests apples, pears and quince and plants indoor bulbs, we meet a Northern Irish daffodil breeder, and Carol Klein travels to Wales to explore the Eupatorium with a passionate gardener who has a rare and spectacular collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don and Nigel make the most of the season and prepare for the winter ahead. Meanwhile Carol Klein is in Surrey looking at wild and cultivated heathers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's dividing his Pulmonaria and gives advice on frost-protection, Joe visits a tropical oasis outside Bristol, and Carol looks at Rowans from around the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol is looking at one of the gems of early spring; the crocus, Joe visits a bog garden in west Wales, and Rachel visits a fabulous rose garden with over 2500 different varieties.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol looks at the spring delight that is the cyclamen, Joe visits a gardener taking on the challenges of gardening on the windswept Cornish coastline, and Monty tackles the problem of box blight.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives tips on moving plants which are in the wrong place or have outgrown their space, shows how to store chilies and harvests the last of his tomatoes. Rachel de Thame returns to Longmeadow to talk to Monty about her return to health and to plant up pots for spring colour.

programme.desc: It's all about the maintenance this week at Longmeadow, as Monty cuts back and divides spring flowering plants. Nick Bailey goes to Ham House in Richmond to see how they are coping with the ravages of box tree caterpillar and Arit Anderson visits a garden in Suffolk to find out about the concept of rewilding.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Atlanta is a city famous for vibrant art and tasty food, so for this episode the DIRT team went looking for the real people behind the scenes working to make this city so special. Josh meets celebrated chefs, barbers, farmers, and even a butter-wrapping machine dubbed André 4000 because he's "the second best 'wrapper' in Atlanta"—though special guest Killer Mike would probably take issue with that. Thirty years ago the real André announced to the world "the South got something to say," so tune in and listen up.

After filming his son kill his first 200″ monster, Kris Seymour chases big bucks in Kansas, Oklahoma and Canada.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Chandler is kicking season off in KS during the early season and has to get creative to pull it off from the ground! He's familiar with the "Narrow 10" after having a great encounter with him 2 years prior. Closing this story on the Schumacher's farm was a special one with the ground strategy we put together!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Atlanta is a city famous for vibrant art and tasty food, so for this episode the DIRT team went looking for the real people behind the scenes working to make this city so special. Josh meets celebrated chefs, barbers, farmers, and even a butter-wrapping machine dubbed André 4000 because he's "the second best 'wrapper' in Atlanta"—though special guest Killer Mike would probably take issue with that. Thirty years ago the real André announced to the world "the South got something to say," so tune in and listen up.
Get ready for one of the best seasons yet from Team200! From giant elk to monster bears and a couple 200″ whitetails, you don’t want to miss a single episode from Team200 this year!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.title: Wings of Courage
programme.desc: The film tells the dramatic story of three legendary French aviators and the first historic airmail flights in the Andes. It combines a tale of high adventure and excitement with cutting-edge technology, and is the fulfillment of one of Annaud's long-held dreams.

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: When Felix finds himself in the middle of a carefully orchestrated heist, he takes it upon himself to find the real perpetrators and clear his name.

programme.title: Bad Country
programme.desc: Set in 1983, this is the tale of a Baton Rouge detective who uses an informant to infiltrate the most sinister criminal enterprise in the South.

programme.title: Toy Soldiers
programme.desc: The teen action classic about a group of troublesome students from an exclusive prep school who defend it when Colombian terrorists lay siege to it.

programme.title: U-Turn
programme.desc: A criminal looking to pay off his debts meets a couple in Arizona who hope to use him to settle their personal vendettas, even if it involves murder.

programme.title: A Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: When an Arizona astronomer discovers a comet heading toward Earth, the president attempts to divert it by using a nuclear missile.

programme.title: The Lazarus Project
programme.desc: A reformed thief is drawn back into a burglary-gone-wrong that lands him on death row, until he mysteriously wakes up in a psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: Lake Placid
programme.desc: At a serene Maine lake, a 30-foot reptilian eating machine hungers for a fragile paleontologist on her first field assignment and a tasty billionaire.

programme.title: Death at a Funeral
programme.desc: Family rivalries, secrets, and the appearance of a mysterious stranger threaten to undermine a young man’s effort to give his father a proper funeral.

programme.title: Blonde Ambition
programme.desc: After small-town Katie follows her fiance to New York and catches him with another woman, she rebounds with a dream job that isn't what it appears.

programme.title: The First Time
programme.desc: What begins as a casual chat turns into something more complex, as a romance blooms between a high school junior and a senior on his way to college.

programme.title: Wedding Wars
programme.desc: A gay party planner agrees to organize the nuptials for his straight brother until he finds out that he is behind a speech against gay marriage.

programme.title: Sueño
programme.desc: An inspiring story of love and music, Antonio moves from Mexico to Los Angeles to pursue his dreams of sharing his music with the world.

programme.title: Vice Versa
programme.desc: An ill-gotten mystical skull has a body-and-mind-switching effect on a high-powered department store exec and his neglected 11-year-old son.

programme.title: I Dreamed of Africa
programme.desc: A bored Italian socialite abandons her jet-set lifestyle for the rigors and rewards of rural Kenya in this true story based on a best-selling memoir.

programme.title: Wind
programme.desc: The open seas are ripe for adventure and romance as a man does his best to win the America’s Cup for the U.S. in a string of yacht races.

programme.title: All the Pretty Horses
programme.desc: The dreams of an American wanting to live the cowboy way in Mexico become a web of murder and betrayal when he falls for a powerful man’s daughter.

programme.title: The Waterdance
programme.desc: Injured in a climbing accident, writer Joel Garcia (Eric Stoltz) wakes up in a hospital having lost the use of his legs. Soon after, he's placed in a recovery ward where he begins the arduous process of rehabilitation and meets others with injuries like his own. Raymond (Wesley Snipes) is a ladies' man whose girl has nevertheless split, and Bloss (William Forsythe) is a rather prejudiced biker. Together, this unlikely trio helps one another to overcome the greatest challenge of their lives.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: Berserk
programme.desc: Suspicions fall on the imperious ringmistress of a traveling circus when she appears unfazed by a series of mysterious and grisly murders.

programme.title: The Undercover Man
programme.desc: Determined Treasury Department investigator Frank Warren (Glenn Ford) goes after a ruthless mobster known as The Big Fellow. When a key informant is murdered, Warren pursues the gangster on charges of tax evasion. But, with a slick mob lawyer hampering him at every turn, and threats being lobbed toward Warren's wife (Nina Foch), the lawman's chances of achieving a conviction are slim to none. His only hope is that one syndicate bookkeeper will have the courage to turn state's evidence.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: Murderer's Row
programme.desc: Secret agent Matt Helm must rescue the kidnapped inventor of an ultra-destructive "helio beam" capable of destroying Washington, D.C.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: To Sir, With Love
programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: Cactus Flower
programme.desc: A dentist pretends he's married to avoid committing to his girlfriend. When she asks to meet his wife, he enlists his nurse to pose as his spouse.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: During World War II, a dilapidated vessel, the Caine, gets a new ensign, Willis Keith (Robert Francis), and a new captain, Commander Queeg (Humphrey Bogart). The crew sees Queeg's unconventional behavior as irrational, and communications officer Thomas Keefer (Fred MacMurray) spreads suspicion about his suitability as captain. When a dire situation during a storm forces the executive officer (Van Johnson) to relieve Queeg of his duties, he and Ensign Keith are tried for mutiny.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Pushover
programme.desc: To get the lowdown on stolen cash, a duty-bound cop makes a move on the girlfriend of a murderous bank robber and accidentally falls for her.

programme.title: Our Man in Havana
programme.desc: A vacuum cleaner salesman is recruited as a spy by the British secret service. Despite his phony reports and lies, he quickly gains importance.

programme.title: Salome
programme.desc: Salome tries to save John the Baptist from losing his head to the sword of King Herod, reversing the story that she was responsible for his death.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finacé, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: After a volcano erupts on a South Sea island, a fallen priest and three convicts race to save the lives of children in a mountaintop leper colony.

programme.title: We Were Strangers
programme.desc: When her brother is murdered, China Valdez (Jennifer Jones) swears revenge on the corrupt Cuban government he had been protesting. She joins the resistance led by Tony (John Garfield), an American with a plan that promises devastating results to their enemies. First they'll kill a government official, then plant a bomb at the funeral, which will wipe out the dead man's associates when it explodes. All they need to do is to dig an underground tunnel from China's house to the cemetery next door.

programme.title: The Jolson Story
programme.desc: At the turn of the 20th century, young Asa Yoelson (Scotty Beckett) decides to go against the wishes of his cantor father (Ludwig Donath) and pursue a career in show business. Gradually working his way up through the vaudeville ranks, Asa -- now calling himself Al Jolson (Larry Parks) -- joins a blackface minstrel troupe and soon builds a reputation as a consummate performer. But as his career grows in size, so does his ego, resulting in battles in business as well as in his personal life.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter crossing the Arizona desert routs a band of marauding Apaches and rescues the young survivor of a massacre.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: Shut My Big Mouth
programme.desc: An Eastern milquetoast (Joe E. Brown) takes on outlaws in the Wild West.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: Black Noon
programme.desc: In the Old West, a young, traveling minister and his wife get caught up in a web of witchcraft involving a mute beauty and a satanic gunfighter.

programme.title: Indian Uprising
programme.desc: Gold thieves and the government rile Geronimo, despite a cavalry captain's (George Montgomery) efforts at peace.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.title: The White Squaw
programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: Thunderhoof
programme.desc: Two men and a young woman in the Mexican wilderness are intent on tracking down a wild stallion.

programme.title: Fort Ti
programme.desc: Capt. Horn (George Montgomery) and Rogers' Rangers raid Fort Ticonderoga during the French and Indian War.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: Lightning Guns
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) investigates the murder of a banker who was about to loan a rancher some money for a controversial dam project.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Edge of Eternity
programme.desc: Widowed Les Martin (Cornel Wilde) is an ex-detective haunted by a case he left behind in Denver. Now, Martin is the deputy sheriff of a small Arizona town with nothing to do but pull over beautiful local socialite Janice Kendon (Victoria Shaw) for occasional speeding -- until a mysterious murder at a nearby ghost town requires him to put his old skills to use once again. With the help of Sheriff Edwards (Edgar Buchanan) and Kendon, Martin must unravel a murderous plot involving stolen gold.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: Trail of the Rustlers
programme.desc: When a member of the villainous Mahoney family is slain while escaping the jail cell he'd been put in by Steve Armitage (Charles Starrett), aka the Durango Kid, the dead man's relatives vow to take down the Kid by any means necessary. Chick Mahoney (Don Harvey) poses as the Kid and tries to ruin the cowboy's reputation by stealing from nearby ranchers, but with the help of sidekick Smiley Burnette (Smiley Burnette), the Kid sets out to retrieve the stolen goods and repair his good name.

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: For a fee, hard-drinking Texas marshal Guthrie McCabe (James Stewart) agrees to help Army officer Jim Gary (Richard Widmark) search for a group of whites who were abducted years earlier by Comanche warriors. After rescuing two of the abductees, McCabe and Gary find that the former captives have fully adopted the culture of their American Indian captors and are barely recognizable. Cultures collide as they attempt to return the settlers to their original -- and now long-forgotten -- lives.

programme.title: North By Northwest
programme.desc: A lethal case of mistaken identity plunges a New York ad man into a race across the continent as he's pursued by foreign spies out to kill him.

programme.title: Weekend at the Waldorf
programme.desc: The lives of guests and staff intertwine at a hotel over one weekend.

programme.title: Boys Town
programme.desc: True story of Father Flanagan's fight to build a home for orphaned boys.

programme.title: Tom Thumb
programme.desc: A six-inch-tall boy takes on a pair of comical crooks.

programme.title: Juarez
programme.desc: The true story of Mexico's Abe Lincoln and his fight against the French.

programme.title: Gun Crazy

programme.title: Three Godfathers
programme.desc: Fugitives risk their lives to bring a baby out of the desert to safety.

programme.title: She
programme.desc: Explorers uncover a lost kingdom ruled by an immortal queen.

programme.title: Bundle of Joy
programme.desc: A shop girl is mistaken for the mother of a foundling.

programme.title: The Great Race
programme.desc: Set in 1908, dastardly, black-garbed Professor Fate dares the world's greatest hero, The Great Leslie, to race 22,000 miles from New York to Paris.

programme.title: The Human Comedy
programme.desc: A small-town telegraph boy deals with growing up during World War II.

programme.title: The Sheepman
programme.desc: A sheep farmer battles the local cattle baron for land and a woman.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Robin Hood
programme.desc: In this swashbuckling classic, the legendary hero fights to rid England of the tyranny of Prince John and win the love of the beautiful Maid Marian.

programme.title: The Americanization of Emily
programme.desc: A black comedy about honor, cowardice and unexpected heroism.

programme.title: City for Conquest
programme.desc: A driver risks his sight when he boxes to pay for his brother's education.

programme.title: A Guy Named Joe
programme.desc: A bomber pilot goes to heaven and becomes guardian angel to another pilot.

programme.title: The In-Laws (1979)
programme.desc: The father of the groom drags the bride's father into madcap adventures.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: While examining bodies deemed unidentifiable, interns uncover the identity of a man who died in the 9/11 terrorist attacks.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A pod containing the remains of a crime-scene cleaner washes onto a beach; Angela and Hodgins learn a secret about Cam.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a street artist falls into his own adhesive, he also lands on human remains that stay glued to his body; Booth searches a comedy club for suspects.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a psychic tries to help the spirit of a boy whose death the team is investigating, members of the team start to question their own feelings on life and death.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the team investigates the death of a dancer who was about to audition for a dance competition show, Booth and Brennan go under cover as contestants.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When Taylor's former protégé is killed while preventing a bioweapon from falling into the wrong hands, Mac and the team must find the weapon so Desi can pull off the ultimate heist before it's sold to a terrorist cell.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When Russ is kidnapped, Mac and the team must break out a previously murderous psychopath, now pacifist, from prison to help find him; while on the run, Mac and Desi are forced to confront their relationship issues.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac's meeting with Desi's parents goes sideways when her brother finds himself in trouble and needing their help; Russ and Matty must ask an old nemesis for assistance when their new recruitment candidate is kidnapped.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Using a cryptic postcard as their only clue, Mac and the team must solve a fallen friend's final case and bring him justice.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: A secret experimental cancer treatment Mac's developing with a friend is discovered when culprits ransack their lab, kidnap Mac's partner and plan to use the research to create a powerful new nerve agent.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and team rush to help when Matty's former mentor, Ian Cain, and his embassy staff come down with a deadly, mysterious illness; Taylor and Bozer work with Jerry Ortega to infiltrate a Codex cell.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When Mac and the team are unable to prevent sensitive intel from falling into Codex's hands, Mac must scale a vertical cliff using only gear he can cobble together himself to prevent the info's transmission.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: While on a mission to hunt down a Codex lead, Mac and the team discover Murdoc hacked their comms and has recorded them for months.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a window washer and finds that the victim is actually a renowned street artist; Grover and Adam look into the murder of a gambler; Junior helps his father when they are reminded of his sister's death.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When the team must locate a girl who purchased a gun from a junkie, it discovers that the firearm, over the course of decades, has affected all of the teammates' lives.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A murdered man's body may hold the key to a 20-year-old case involving a kidnapped girl whose father never stopped looking for her.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Adam investigates the murder of an undercover FBI agent who was about to wed the daughter of a Yakuza leader; Noelani is held hostage and forced, along with her mentor Dr. Chu, to operate at gunpoint on a criminal.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett helps his sister spy on her shady neighbors; a ride-share driver and his passenger are murdered; the team teases the youngest members when Junior escorts Tani to a wedding.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Fugitive hacker Aaron Wright resurfaces to ask for help when his co-workers at the NSA are murdered; Junior speaks at the parole hearing of the drunken driver who killed his sister.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Five-0 continues to hunt down escaped criminal Aaron Wright before he can sell cyber-weapons to the highest bidder; the lives of McGarrett and the team members are put in danger when a visitor comes to headquarters to make amends.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A new ally helps McGarrett and the team when mob bosses on the island are targeted by an assassin; the team says goodbye to one of its own.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Tani and Junior must plot an escape for themselves and several civilians after they become trapped inside a deadly tunnel collapse; Eddie the dog sniffs out a bomb that has been planted in McGarrett's home.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A plane that mysteriously crashed into the Pacific in the '80s is found, but with a recently murdered scuba diver inside; McGarrett and Quinn zero in on who planted the bomb in his garage; McGarrett formally asks Quinn to join the team.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Five-0 enlists imprisoned hacker Aaron Wright to help when a young girl is reported kidnapped.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates a home invasion that turned deadly after a dangerous "monster" escaped from the basement; Max returns to Oahu with a very special guest.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A deadly hit-and-run involves a driverless car carrying heroin; Tani and Quinn are stuck with a pair of YouTubers who are brought on a ride-along.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When the CIA informs McGarrett that his mother has gone rogue on her undercover mission and may have killed her partner, Steve goes to Mexico to bring her home and prove her innocence.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team searches for a killer whose plane crashed in the jungle with $10 million worth of heroin on board; Grover is thrilled when his niece Siobhan comes to try out for the University of Hawaii basketball team.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Junior and Tani track down the thief who robbed his parents' home; Five-0 investigates the murder of a beloved philanthropist and the theft of his valuable koa tree; Danny moves in with McGarrett.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Calleigh's professional and personal life are in danger after someone attempts to murder her.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A wealthy family's nanny is found stabbed to death in their home during a party.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A rare and illegal machine gun vaporizes three weapons smugglers, launching the CSI team into a desperate search for it.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team uncovers a methedrine lab in a murder victim's apartment; an unscrupulous FBI agent has a secret life.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: While visiting her family's restaurant in the French Quarter, a Navy culinary specialist is the target of an explosion; in D.C., Brody tracks a lead in the Gen. Leak case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS teams with Homeland Security when the murder of a Navy master diver is discovered to be linked to the chatter concerning a foreign attack on the city.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team discovers a mole in the ranks while helping the Department of Homeland Security locate 900 pounds of missing explosives that are a threat to New Orleans.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team joins forces with several federal agencies to stop a sniper who has been targeting crowded events in the city; FBI Special Agent Tammy Gregario begins investigating Pride's team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride faces more repercussions from the FBI after he helps a former Navy Intelligence Analyst who is the primary suspect in a multiple homicide case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After the discovery of a petty officer's body inside a sports arena, evidence leads Pride and the NCIS team to a kidnapping case of another petty officer, last seen in Mexico.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS must come to the rescue of one of its own when Sebastian is kidnapped while dining in a restaurant with his mother; Sebastian relies on his gaming skills in a prison break.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS and the FBI investigate a private plane crash in the bayou that killed three sailors; Sonja and Lasalle interview candidates for a job opening on the team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy SEAL candidate is murdered weeks before his graduation; Wade seeks Pride's help when her adopted son announces his plan to join the Navy.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A sailor is murdered during a rowdy motorcycle rally in the city; Lasalle seeks personal advice from Gregorio.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After a member of the United States Navy Band is murdered in her home, Pride looks after the victim's nephew, who is the only witness to the crime.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates when a Marine corporal who is an amateur race car driver is in a fatal crash on the track.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride needs to protect a family friend engaged to the prime suspect in an ongoing NCIS and FBI cartel case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Martin Wroath is found dead in his home in Midsomer Worthy, Barnaby is unconvinced that he committed suicide with his own shotgun in an unnecessarily complex fashion. When a second murder occurs on an assault course at a local cottage hospital, in which Wroath was a patient, the detective suspects a link between the two murders, and soon finds a wealth of hatred, jealously and lies, before discovering that rope in the village is mysteriously disappearing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce is taking part in an open-air art class, being held on the village green of Midsomer Florey, when she discovers the body of an elderly fellow student, Ruth Fairfax, concealed beneath some undergrowth shortly after a session. Just as Barnaby begins to learn that Ruth was not all she seemed to be, officers of the NIS pull him off the case. While Troy is allowed to assist them, Barnaby is left handling a local operation into a spate of thefts, yet he decides to continue his investigations in secret. In doing so, he soon turns up armed robbery, unaccounted stolen money, former criminals, and secret liaisons, before discovering that the NIS investigation is not being as thorough as it should be.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At his family home in Upper Warden, arrogant actor Larry Smith is killed, when a summer house he walks in to as part of a promotion for the sequel to his hit film, The House of Satan, is suddenly destroyed in an explosion. His family quickly fling accusations for his murder directly at the residents of rival village, Lower Warden, leading Barnaby and Troy to determine if this is the case, especially when Larry's director, another member of the family, is electrocuted while using an exercise bike. It's not long before secrets, affairs and blackmail begin to surface from within the two villages.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: While Troy assists an attractive wildlife liaison officer with an investigation into the illegal sale of protected bird eggs, Barnaby travels to Midsomer Magna to investigate the sudden death of a man, who apparently drowned himself. While there was evidence he was desperately seeking to avoid bankruptcy, and had visited a local millionaire to get back his money from a scheme he had invested in, a post mortem reveals that he had been murdered. The two detectives soon find their investigations crossing over, when a man found to have an illegal collection of bird eggs, is also murdered, prompting concerns that the millionaire's scheme is being used to defraud many, and that someone is willing to kill to keep the scheme going.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Causton is buzzing at the opening of a new brewery on the site of a famously cursed Abbey. But excitement turns to fear when a man is found boiled to death in one of the vats. DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are puzzled; could this really be about beer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Mahesh Sidana - butterfly collector and founding member of an elite IQ society - is found murdered, pinned to a wall in a manner akin to his treasured butterfly specimens, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are thrust into a crime that impacts not only on their community, but internationally. With the help of an old friend, can they catch the culprit before another victim is found...?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Carver Valley’s comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel. With a scathing comic shaming several villagers as the only lead, Barnaby and Winter are left trying to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby gets to relive his former days of sporting glory when a death at the local Rugby Club sends Barnaby and Winter into a muddle of rucks, old grudges, new romances… and artisanal chocolates?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is less than impressed when Sarah drags him to a family friend’s wedding. But things soon go from bad to worse when tragedy strikes and Barnaby is called into action to catch a murderer with an apparent penchant for local brides.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferrabees Circus comes to town, bringing with it a chain of sinister clown sightings, threatening notes and deathly dangerous circus acts. Barnaby will have to face up to his fears in order to solve the case

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. In the midst of a Civil War re-enactment the family relive their own historic battles with their hostile neighbours. But what is the truth about the DeQuettevilles - and the ghostly rider?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local villagers in Morton Fendle are up in arms, demanding answers from Alan Hollingsworth, the owner of a local craft centre they had invested in, after news comes out that it has recently fallen into financial turmoil. As tensions begin rising in the village, Barnaby soon suspects that something has happened to Alan's wife, Simone, when his behaviour suddenly changes. His suspicions are soon confirmed when it transpires that Simone was kidnapped, after one of Alan's neighbours is murdered, shortly after witnessing something they shouldn't have.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a local New Age commune called the Lodge of the Golden Windhorse, dies suddenly after falling down some stairs and breaking his neck. Although there was uncertainty as to whether it was the result of an accident or murder, Barnaby and Troy find themselves having to determine which it was, when Ian Craigie, the commune's leader, is stabbed to death with a carving knife a few days later, while attending a spiritual seance with the rest of the commune and the parents of one of its members. It's not long before they discover hidden truths about the commune's founding and some of its members.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After a local photographer wins an urban myth competition with his creation of The Wolf Hunter, it unexpectedly gains a cult following. However, when a man is killed, Barnaby and Winter must investigate if this myth has become murderous reality.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
